description: Updates the configuration of an existing bot.

parameters.name: botId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the bot to update. This identifier is returned by the CreateBot operation.

parameters.name: botName
parameters.description: The new name of the bot. The name must be unique in the account that creates the bot.

parameters.name: roleArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that has permissions to access the bot.

parameters.name: dataPrivacy
parameters.description: Provides information on additional privacy protections Amazon Lex should use with the bot's data. For each Amazon Lex bot created with the Amazon Lex Model Building Service, you must specify whether your use of Amazon Lex is related to a website, program, or other application that is directed or targeted, in whole or in part, to children under age 13 and subject to the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act (COPPA) by specifying true or false in the childDirected field. By specifying true in the childDirected field, you confirm that your use of Amazon Lex is related to a website, program, or other application that is directed or targeted, in whole or in part, to children under age 13 and subject to COPPA. By specifying false in the childDirected field, you confirm that your use of Amazon Lex is not related to a website, program, or other application that is directed or targeted, in whole or in part, to children under age 13 and subject to COPPA. You may not specify a default value for the childDirected field that does not accurately reflect whether your use of Amazon Lex is related to a website, program, or other application that is directed or targeted, in whole or in part, to children under age 13 and subject to COPPA. If your use of Amazon Lex relates to a website, program, or other application that is directed in whole or in part, to children under age 13, you must obtain any required verifiable parental consent under COPPA. For information regarding the use of Amazon Lex in connection with websites, programs, or other applications that are directed or targeted, in whole or in part, to children under age 13, see the Amazon Lex FAQ.

parameters.name: idleSessionTTLInSeconds
parameters.description: The time, in seconds, that Amazon Lex should keep information about a user's conversation with the bot. A user interaction remains active for the amount of time specified. If no conversation occurs during this time, the session expires and Amazon Lex deletes any data provided before the timeout. You can specify between 60 (1 minute) and 86,400 (24 hours) seconds.

parameters.name: botMembers
parameters.description: The list of bot members in the network associated with the update action. (dict) --- A bot that is a member of a network of bots. The unique ID of a bot that is a member of this network of bots. The unique name of a bot that is a member of this network of bots. The alias ID of a bot that is a member of this network of bots. The alias name of a bot that is a member of this network of bots. The version of a bot that is a member of this network of bots.

nested_params.name: botMemberId
nested_params.description: The unique ID of a bot that is a member of this network of bots.

nested_params.name: botMemberName
nested_params.description: The unique name of a bot that is a member of this network of bots.

nested_params.name: botMemberAliasId
nested_params.description: The alias ID of a bot that is a member of this network of bots.

nested_params.name: botMemberAliasName
nested_params.description: The alias name of a bot that is a member of this network of bots.

nested_params.name: botMemberVersion
nested_params.description: The version of a bot that is a member of this network of bots.

parameters.name: errorLogSettings
parameters.description: Allows you to modify how Amazon Lex logs errors during bot interactions, including destinations for error logs and the types of errors to be captured. Settings parameters for the error logs, when it is enabled.

nested_params.name: enabled
nested_params.description: Settings parameters for the error logs, when it is enabled.

nested_items.name: botId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier of the bot that was updated.

nested_items.name: botName
nested_items.description: The name of the bot after the update.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: The description of the bot after the update.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role used by the bot after the update.

nested_items.name: dataPrivacy
nested_items.description: The data privacy settings for the bot after the update.

nested_items.name: childDirected
nested_items.description: For each Amazon Lex bot created with the Amazon Lex Model Building Service, you must specify whether your use of Amazon Lex is related to a website, program, or other application that is directed or targeted, in whole or in part, to children under age 13 and subject to the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act (COPPA) by specifying true or false in the childDirected field. By specifying true in the childDirected field, you confirm that your use of Amazon Lex is related to a website, program, or other application that is directed or targeted, in whole or in part, to children under age 13 and subject to COPPA. By specifying false in the childDirected field, you confirm that your use of Amazon Lex is not related to a website, program, or other application that is directed or targeted, in whole or in part, to children under age 13 and subject to COPPA. You may not specify a default value for the childDirected field that does not accurately reflect whether your use of Amazon Lex is related to a website, program, or other application that is directed or targeted, in whole or in part, to children under age 13 and subject to COPPA. If your use of Amazon Lex relates to a website, program, or other application that is directed in whole or in part, to children under age 13, you must obtain any required verifiable parental consent under COPPA. For information regarding the use of Amazon Lex in connection with websites, programs, or other applications that are directed or targeted, in whole or in part, to children under age 13, see the Amazon Lex FAQ.

nested_items.name: idleSessionTTLInSeconds
nested_items.description: The session timeout, in seconds, for the bot after the update.

nested_items.name: botStatus
nested_items.description: Shows the current status of the bot. The bot is first in the Creating status. Once the bot is read for use, it changes to the Available status. After the bot is created, you can use the DRAFT version of the bot.

nested_items.name: creationDateTime
nested_items.description: A timestamp of the date and time that the bot was created.

nested_items.name: lastUpdatedDateTime
nested_items.description: A timestamp of the date and time that the bot was last updated.

nested_items.name: botType
nested_items.description: The type of the bot that was updated.

nested_items.name: botMembers
nested_items.description: The list of bot members in the network that was updated.

nested_items.name: botMemberId
nested_items.description: The unique ID of a bot that is a member of this network of bots.

nested_items.name: botMemberName
nested_items.description: The unique name of a bot that is a member of this network of bots.

nested_items.name: botMemberAliasId
nested_items.description: The alias ID of a bot that is a member of this network of bots.

nested_items.name: botMemberAliasName
nested_items.description: The alias name of a bot that is a member of this network of bots.

nested_items.name: botMemberVersion
nested_items.description: The version of a bot that is a member of this network of bots.

nested_items.name: errorLogSettings
nested_items.description: Settings for managing error logs within the response of an update bot operation.

nested_items.name: enabled
nested_items.description: Settings parameters for the error logs, when it is enabled.
